ETYMOLOGY: From French reconnaissance (literally 'recognition'), from Old French reconoistre 'to recognize, know again', from Latin recognoscere 'to know again, recall, recognize'. The military sense developed in the early 19th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A preliminary survey or exploration to gather information, especially about enemy positions, troop movements, or the geography of an area.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 侦察；勘察。指为了获取信息（尤指敌方阵地、部队调动或区域地理信息）而进行的初步调查或探索。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The drone conducted a reconnaissance flight over the target area.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 无人机对目标区域进行了侦察飞行。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A preliminary examination or survey, especially in engineering or geology, to ascertain facts and gather information.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 初步考察；勘探。指为了确定事实和收集信息而进行的初步检查或调查，尤其在工程或地质领域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The engineers completed a thorough reconnaissance of the site before drafting the construction plans.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 工程师们在起草施工计划前完成了对该地点的全面勘察。

REGISTER: Formal, Technical (especially military, scientific, or engineering contexts)
